meanings.sent1: A gaggles of geese flew over the lake.
meanings.sent2: I saw a gaggles of geese at the park yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The gaggles of geese honked happily as they waddled by.
meanings.sent4: The gaggles of geese resembled a white cloud in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The noisy gaggles of geese created a beautiful sight in the sky.

meanings.definition: A disorderly or noisy group of people or things
meanings.sent1: The market was filled with gaggles of shoppers on the weekend.
meanings.sent2: There were gaggles of children running around the playground.
meanings.sent3: The gaggles of tourists made the city streets lively.
meanings.sent4: The gaggles of papers on his desk made it hard to find anything.
meanings.sent5: The gaggles of excited fans cheered loudly at the concert.
